CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , a town in LOC .
CARDINAL . The applicant brought CARDINAL civil actions against ORG seeking to liquidate NORP commodity bonds and saving certiﬁcates .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( “ RUB ” ) . This judgment became binding on DATE , but was not enforced .
CARDINAL . On DATE the town court awarded the applicant RUB CARDINAL . This judgment became binding on DATE , and was enforced on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the town court awarded the applicant RUB ORG . This judgment became binding on DATE . On DATE it was quashed in supervisory - review proceedings . Nevertheless , on DATE the sum due was by mistake paid to the applicant . ORG sought to recover the mistakenly paid sum , but on DATE ORG decided that the applicant could keep the money as compensation for the judgment ’s lengthy non - enforcement .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment within DATE .
